:wave: Hello all!

I am looking to add Telegram support to HubSpot.

It seems like the most ideal way would be if the `Crm.Engagements.Communications` <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/communications|API> supported a `TELEGRAM` type natively, but I see that isn’t possible (as HubSpot would have to add it as a feature).

Next best thing would be if we were able to create a custom engagement type (or a custom communications type) — is that possible?

To get something up and running quickly, I was thinking of creating a custom <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/timeline|Timeline Event> <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/timeline|Template>, and batch telegram messages into the same event.

Ideally, it would look very similar to the native `Email` timeline event — Emails are threaded, and you can respond to the thread directly from the Timeline. Do we know if I can create an input box on my custom timeline event, letting the user type in a message and click a “send” button (which would make an API call through my app)

Hi Everyone, can you set multiple audiences for knowledge base. My client has 4 different types of memberships in their current knowledge and they are wondering if they can do the same with HubSpot's knowledge base

Yes you definitely can create a custom engagement type (through marketplace apps) but it does require a good amount of knowledge of the timeline events api. It would look very similar to how the email events look
are there docs on the custom engagement type? when I was clicking through the API docs I didn’t see anything about defining custom engagements
